title: How to Roast Oysters

methods.name: Making Oven-Roasted Oysters with Herb Butter

steps.headline: Combine the butter with parsley, shallots, lemon, and garlic.
steps.description: Place the softened stick of butter in a food processor and add 1/4 cup (5 g) of roughly chopped fresh parsley along with 2 tablespoons (20 g) of minced shallots, 1 1/2 teaspoons (3 g) of grated lemon zest, and 1 tablespoon (8 g) of roasted garlic. Pulse the mixture until it's combined. Taste the herb butter and mix in salt and pepper according to your taste.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and wash the oysters.
steps.description: Rinse 24 oysters in their shells and use a small brush to scrub the shells. Scrub and rinse the shells until any dirt or debris is removed. Discard any oysters that are open.

steps.headline: Line a baking sheet with sliced baguette or rock salt, if using.
steps.description: Get out a rimmed baking sheet and cut 1 baguette into 1/2-inch (1.3 cm) thick slices. Lay the slices on the baking sheet in a single layer. If you prefer, you can spread 3 to 4 cups (1.5 to 2 kg) of rock salt over the baking sheet instead.

steps.headline: Open the oysters.
steps.description: Put on a pair of thick gloves to protect your hands. Use an oyster knife to remove to open each shell. Place an oyster so the curved side is against the palm of 1 hand. Use the other hand to insert the tip of the oyster knife into the oyster. Slide the knife along the hinge so the top lid lifts up.

steps.headline: Arrange the open oysters on the baguette or rock salt.
steps.description: Discard the top lids and place the halves with the oysters on the baguette slices or rock salt, if you're using it. The baguette or rock salt will keep the open oysters level on the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Top each oyster with 1 teaspoon (4.5 g) of the herb butter.
steps.description: Measure a spoonful of the soft herb butter and place it on the raw oyster. Divide the rest of the butter among the oysters.

steps.headline: Roast the oysters for 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Put the baking sheet of oysters in the oven and cook them until the butter melts. The oysters should be set once they've finished cooking.

steps.headline: Remove the oysters and serve them immediately.
steps.description: Turn off the oven and take the sheet of oysters out. Transfer the roasted oysters to serving plates or serve them directly from the baking sheet along with the crisp baguette slices. Avoid storing leftover oysters.

steps.headline: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to high heat.
steps.description: If you have a gas grill, turn it between 400 °F (204 °C) and 450 °F (232 °C). To heat a charcoal grill to high, fill a chimney with briquettes and light them. When the coals are hot and slightly ashy, dump them in the center of the grill.

steps.headline: Rinse and scrub the oyster.
steps.description: Rinse 2 dozen oysters under clean water. Put on a pair of gloves to protect your hands and use a small brush to scrub the shells. Keep scrubbing to remove dirt or grit.

steps.headline: Place the oysters on the hot grill and cover them with a wet burlap bag.
steps.description: Set each oyster directly on the grill so they're in a single layer. Lay a wet burlap bag right on the oysters so they're completely covered. Discard any oysters that are open. The wet burlap will trap moisture so the oysters steam as they cook.

steps.headline: Cover the grill and cook the oysters for 10 to 12 minutes.
steps.description: Put the lid on the grill to keep the heat high. Leave the oysters to roast until they open on their own.

steps.headline: Use tongs to take the oysters off of the grill.
steps.description: Remove the lid from the grill and transfer the oysters to a serving plate or platter.

steps.headline: Serve the roasted oysters immediately.
steps.description: Set out cocktail sauce and saltine crackers to serve with the roasted oysters. Avoid storing roasted oysters since they don't keep well.

text: Making Oven-Roasted Oysters with Herb Butter Combine the butter with parsley, shallots, lemon, and garlic. Place the softened stick of butter in a food processor and add 1/4 cup (5 g) of roughly chopped fresh parsley along with 2 tablespoons (20 g) of minced shallots, 1 1/2 teaspoons (3 g) of grated lemon zest, and 1 tablespoon (8 g) of roasted garlic. Pulse the mixture until it's combined. Taste the herb butter and mix in salt and pepper according to your taste. Preheat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and wash the oysters. Rinse 24 oysters in their shells and use a small brush to scrub the shells. Scrub and rinse the shells until any dirt or debris is removed. Discard any oysters that are open. Line a baking sheet with sliced baguette or rock salt, if using. Get out a rimmed baking sheet and cut 1 baguette into 1/2-inch (1.3 cm) thick slices. Lay the slices on the baking sheet in a single layer. If you prefer, you can spread 3 to 4 cups (1.5 to 2 kg) of rock salt over the baking sheet instead. Open the oysters. Put on a pair of thick gloves to protect your hands. Use an oyster knife to remove to open each shell. Place an oyster so the curved side is against the palm of 1 hand. Use the other hand to insert the tip of the oyster knife into the oyster. Slide the knife along the hinge so the top lid lifts up. Arrange the open oysters on the baguette or rock salt. Discard the top lids and place the halves with the oysters on the baguette slices or rock salt, if you're using it. The baguette or rock salt will keep the open oysters level on the baking sheet. Top each oyster with 1 teaspoon (4.5 g) of the herb butter. Measure a spoonful of the soft herb butter and place it on the raw oyster. Divide the rest of the butter among the oysters. Roast the oysters for 8 to 10 minutes. Put the baking sheet of oysters in the oven and cook them until the butter melts. The oysters should be set once they've finished cooking. Remove the oysters and serve them immediately. Turn off the oven and take the sheet of oysters out. Transfer the roasted oysters to serving plates or serve them directly from the baking sheet along with the crisp baguette slices. Avoid storing leftover oysters. Outdoor Lowcountry Oyster Roast Heat a gas or charcoal grill to high heat. If you have a gas grill, turn it between 400 °F (204 °C) and 450 °F (232 °C). To heat a charcoal grill to high, fill a chimney with briquettes and light them. When the coals are hot and slightly ashy, dump them in the center of the grill. Rinse and scrub the oyster. Rinse 2 dozen oysters under clean water. Put on a pair of gloves to protect your hands and use a small brush to scrub the shells. Keep scrubbing to remove dirt or grit. Place the oysters on the hot grill and cover them with a wet burlap bag. Set each oyster directly on the grill so they're in a single layer. Lay a wet burlap bag right on the oysters so they're completely covered. Discard any oysters that are open. The wet burlap will trap moisture so the oysters steam as they cook. Cover the grill and cook the oysters for 10 to 12 minutes. Put the lid on the grill to keep the heat high. Leave the oysters to roast until they open on their own. Use tongs to take the oysters off of the grill. Remove the lid from the grill and transfer the oysters to a serving plate or platter. Serve the roasted oysters immediately. Set out cocktail sauce and saltine crackers to serve with the roasted oysters. Avoid storing roasted oysters since they don't keep well.
